body_html:
No. In tensorflow's abstraction, one operator with its input/output tensors can only be executed on one device. However, you can achieve it by using the following methods:

  1. use the data parallelism mode of tensorflow (parameter server or replication), like distributed tensorflow
  2. create weight tensor for each card, and synchronize them manually, example: https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/tutorials/image/cifar10/cifar10_multi_gpu_train.py
